sources.name: A
sources.query: align(1m, count(ts("kubernetes.node.memory.usage", cluster="${cluster_name}")))

sources.name: A Clone
sources.query: ts("kubernetes.node.memory.usage", cluster="${cluster_name}")

sources.name: A
sources.query: exists(default(0, align(1m, count(lowpass(1, ts("kubernetes.node.status.condition", cluster="${cluster_name}" and condition="Ready"))))))

sources.name: A Clone
sources.query: if(${A}, align(1m, count(lowpass(1, ts("kubernetes.node.status.condition", cluster="${cluster_name}" and condition="Ready")))), 0)

sources.name: utilization
sources.query: ts("kubernetes.node.memory.working_set", cluster="${cluster_name}")/ts("kubernetes.node.memory.node_allocatable", cluster="${cluster_name}")

sources.name: avg_util
sources.query: avg(${utilization}) * 100

sources.name: utilization
sources.query: avg(align(60s, mean, ts("kubernetes.node.cpu.node_utilization", cluster="${cluster_name}"))) * 100

sources.name: alloc_cpu_cores
sources.query: aliasMetric(limit(250, avg(ts("kubernetes.node.cpu.node_allocatable", cluster="${cluster_name}"), sources, nodename)), "CPU Cores")/1000

sources.name: request_cpu_cores
sources.query: aliasMetric(limit(250, avg(ts("kubernetes.node.cpu.request", cluster="${cluster_name}"), sources, nodename)), "CPU Request")/1000

sources.name: request_cpu_cores Clone
sources.query: aliasMetric(limit(250, avg(ts("kubernetes.node.cpu.limit", cluster="${cluster_name}"), sources, nodename)), "CPU Limit")/1000

sources.name: alloc_mem_bytes
sources.query: aliasMetric(limit(250, avg(ts("kubernetes.node.memory.node_allocatable", cluster="${cluster_name}"), sources, nodename)), "Memory Bytes")

sources.name: request_mem_bytes
sources.query: aliasMetric(limit(250, avg(ts("kubernetes.node.memory.request", cluster="${cluster_name}"), sources, nodename)), "Memory Request")

sources.name: A
sources.query: aliasMetric(limit(250,avg(ts("kubernetes.node.cpu.node_utilization", cluster="${cluster_name}"), sources, nodename)) * 100, "CPU Utilization (%)")

sources.name: B
sources.query: aliasMetric(limit(250, avg(ts("kubernetes.node.memory.working_set", cluster="${cluster_name}"), sources, nodename)/avg(ts("kubernetes.node.memory.node_allocatable", cluster="${cluster_name}"), sources, nodename) * 100), "Memory Used (%)")

sources.name: alloc_cpu_cores
sources.query: aliasMetric(limit(250, avg(ts("kubernetes.node.cpu.node_allocatable", cluster="${cluster_name}"), sources, nodename)), "CPU Cores")/1024

sources.name: request_cpu_cores
sources.query: aliasMetric(limit(250, avg(ts("kubernetes.node.cpu.request", cluster="${cluster_name}"), sources, nodename)), "CPU Request")/1024

sources.name: alloc_mem_bytes
sources.query: aliasMetric(limit(250, avg(ts("kubernetes.node.memory.node_allocatable", cluster="${cluster_name}"), sources, nodename)), "Memory Bytes")

sources.name: request_mem_bytes
sources.query: aliasMetric(limit(250, avg(ts("kubernetes.node.memory.request", cluster="${cluster_name}"), sources, nodename)), "Memory Request")

sources.name: request_mem_bytes Clone
sources.query: aliasMetric(limit(250, avg(ts("kubernetes.node.memory.limit", cluster="${cluster_name}"), sources, nodename)), "Memory Limit")

sources.name: A
sources.query: aliasMetric(limit(250,avg(ts("kubernetes.node.cpu.node_utilization", cluster="${cluster_name}"), sources, nodename)) * 100, "CPU Utilization (%)")

sources.name: B
sources.query: aliasMetric(limit(250, avg(ts("kubernetes.node.memory.working_set", cluster="${cluster_name}"), sources, nodename)/avg(ts("kubernetes.node.memory.node_allocatable", cluster="${cluster_name}"), sources, nodename) * 100), "Memory Used (%)")

charts.name: Cluster breakdown Namespace by CPU Limit

sources.name: A
sources.query: sum(align(60s, mean, ts("kubernetes.ns.cpu.limit", cluster="${cluster_name}")), namespace_name)

charts.name: Cluster breakdown Namespace by CPU Request

sources.name: A
sources.query: sum(align(60s, mean, ts("kubernetes.ns.cpu.request", cluster="${cluster_name}")), namespace_name)

charts.name: Cluster breakdown Namespace by CPU Used

sources.name: A
sources.query: sum(align(60s, mean, ts("kubernetes.ns.cpu.usage_rate", cluster="${cluster_name}")), namespace_name)

charts.name: Cluster breakdown Namespace  by Memory Limit

sources.name: A
sources.query: sum(align(60s, mean, ts("kubernetes.ns.memory.limit", cluster="${cluster_name}")), namespace_name)

charts.name: Cluster breakdown Namespace by Memory Request

sources.name: A
sources.query: sum(align(60s, mean, ts("kubernetes.ns.memory.request", cluster="${cluster_name}")), namespace_name)

charts.name: Cluster breakdown Namespace by Memory Used

sources.name: A
sources.query: sum(align(60s, mean, ts("kubernetes.ns.memory.usage", cluster="${cluster_name}")), namespace_name)

sources.name: CPU Usage
sources.query: sum(ts("kubernetes.ns.cpu.usage_rate", cluster="${cluster_name}" and namespace_name="${namespace}"))

sources.name: CPU Request
sources.query: sum(ts("kubernetes.ns.cpu.request", cluster="${cluster_name}" and namespace_name="${namespace}"))

sources.name: CPU Limit
sources.query: sum(ts("kubernetes.ns.cpu.limit", cluster="${cluster_name}" and namespace_name="${namespace}"))

charts.name: PODs CPU Usage

sources.name: cpu_used
sources.query: sum(ts("kubernetes.pod.cpu.usage_rate", cluster="${cluster_name}" and namespace_name="${namespace}" and type="pod"), sources, pod_name)

sources.name: cpu_request
sources.query: sum(ts("kubernetes.pod.cpu.request", cluster="${cluster_name}" and namespace_name="${namespace}" and type="pod"), sources, pod_name)

sources.name: cpu_limit
sources.query: aliasMetric(ts("kubernetes.pod.cpu.limit", cluster="${cluster_name}" and namespace_name="${namespace}" and type="pod"), "Limit")

sources.name: pod_cpu_used
sources.query: aliasMetric(${cpu_used}, "Used")

sources.name: pod_cpu_request
sources.query:
join(
  ${cpu_used} AS ts1 INNER JOIN ${cpu_request} AS ts2 USING(source, pod_name),
  metric='Request', pod_name=ts2.pod_name, source=ts2.source,
  (ts2 + (ts1 * 0)) 
  )

sources.name: pod_cpu_used_join
sources.query:
join(
  ${cpu_used} AS ts1 INNER JOIN ${cpu_request} AS ts2 USING(source, pod_name),
  metric='Used', pod_name=ts1.pod_name, source=ts1.source,
  (ts1 + (ts2 * 0)) 
  )

sources.name: pod_cpu_limit
sources.query:
join(
  ${cpu_used} AS ts1 INNER JOIN ${cpu_limit}  AS ts2 USING(source, pod_name),
  metric='Limit', pod_name=ts2.pod_name,source= ts2.source, 
  (ts2 + (ts1 * 0)) 
 )

sources.name: pod_percent_of_usage
sources.query:
join(
  ${cpu_used} AS ts1 INNER JOIN ${cpu_request}  AS ts2 USING(source,  pod_name),
  metric='% of Request Used', pod_name=ts2.pod_name,source= ts2.source, 
  ((ts1 + (ts2 * 0))  / (ts2 + (ts1 * 0))) * 100
  )

sources.name: pod_percent_of_limit
sources.query:
join(
  ${cpu_used} AS ts1 INNER JOIN ${cpu_limit}  AS ts2 USING(source,  pod_name),
  metric='% of Limit Used', pod_name=ts2.pod_name,source= ts2.source, 
  ((ts1 + (ts2 * 0)) / (ts2 + (ts1 * 0))) * 100
  )

charts.description: The number of Available, Desired and Ready replicas per deployment.

sources.name: Memory Usage
sources.query: sum(ts("kubernetes.ns.memory.usage", cluster="${cluster_name}" and namespace_name="${namespace}"))

sources.name: Memory Request
sources.query: sum(ts("kubernetes.ns.memory.request", cluster="${cluster_name}" and namespace_name="${namespace}"))

sources.name: Memory Limit
sources.query: sum(ts("kubernetes.ns.memory.limit", cluster="${cluster_name}" and namespace_name="${namespace}"))

charts.name: PODs Memory Usage

sources.name: memory_used
sources.query: ts("kubernetes.pod.memory.working_set", cluster="${cluster_name}" and namespace_name="${namespace}" and type="pod")

sources.name: memory_request
sources.query: ts("kubernetes.pod.memory.request", cluster="${cluster_name}" and namespace_name="${namespace}" and type="pod")

sources.name: memory_limit
sources.query: ts("kubernetes.pod.memory.limit", cluster="${cluster_name}" and namespace_name="${namespace}" and type="pod")

sources.name: pod_memory_used
sources.query:
join(
  ${memory_used} AS ts1 INNER JOIN ${memory_request}  AS ts2 USING(source, cluster, namespace_name, pod_name),
  metric='Used', pod_name=ts1.pod_name,source= ts1.source, 
  (ts1) )

sources.name: pod_memory_request
sources.query:
join(
  ${memory_used} AS ts1 INNER JOIN ${memory_request}  AS ts2 USING(source, cluster, namespace_name, pod_name),
  metric='Request', pod_name=ts2.pod_name,source= ts2.source, 
  (ts2) )

sources.name: pod_memory_limit
sources.query:
join(
  ${memory_used} AS ts1 INNER JOIN ${memory_limit}  AS ts2 USING(source, cluster, namespace_name, pod_name),
  metric='Limit', pod_name=ts2.pod_name,source= ts2.source, 
  (ts2) )

sources.name: pod_percent_of_usage
sources.query:
join(
  ${memory_used} AS ts1 INNER JOIN ${memory_request}  AS ts2 USING(source, cluster, namespace_name, pod_name),
  metric='% of  Used', pod_name=ts2.pod_name,source= ts2.source, 
  (ts1 / ts2) * 100
  )

sources.name: pod_percent_of_limit
sources.query:
join(
  ${memory_used} AS ts1 INNER JOIN ${memory_limit}  AS ts2 USING(source, cluster, namespace_name, pod_name),
  metric='% of Limit', pod_name=ts2.pod_name,source= ts2.source, 
  (ts1 / ts2) * 100
  )

charts.description: The number of Available, Desired and Ready replicas per deployment.
